page.title: 20Transport in Pontyclun
page.content: Pontyclun owes its existence to the railways.In earlier years the only local settlement of note was Llantrisant.Then in 1850 the South Wales Railway was built with the line between Cardiff and Swansea passing through the district.In 1860 the Ely Valley Railway was built linking Llantrisant station,Pontyclun,to the Rhondda and Ely Valleys.This led to the development of a settlement around the railway,with homes and amenities being provided for workers on the railway, and to the growth of industry.In later years branch lines were built to Pontypridd and Cowbridge.All these branch lines are now closed,although the main London - Fishguard line still passes through the village.Modern roads have replaced them,including more recently the M4 motorway.
